page.title: 01LANDSCAPE: CUMMOCK VALLEY-1
page.content:
The Cummock Water rises among the conifers of Kyle Forest and flows south-west over moorland to the Doon Valley about five kilometres away. The bottom and sides of its valley are covered by glacial drift and littered with erratics. In this cover there are several short deep gullies some with streamlets tributary to the main river.
On the north edge of Dalmellington there is a former meltwater channel which now carries the B741 road as it drops down from the village before turning north-east towards New Cumnock.
.
